bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records related to Villanova's Division of Student Life including papers of the Vice President for Student Life, the Dean of Students, Student Development, Career Services, the University Counseling Center, and Residence Life. The records consist of administrative files, correspondence, minutes, legal records, printed materials, and reports. Administrative records include job descriptions, policies and procedures, and staff holiday schedules. Correspondence covers a range of topics related to student life, such as food services, housing, fraternities and sororities, University safety, student dress regulations, and alcohol and drug policies. Legal records include Residence Hall House Council constitution, Belle Air printing contracts, and materials related to Amtrak. Minutes are present for the Connelly Center Board of Directors, 1981-1989; dormitories, 1981-1983' Residence Hall Program Committee, 1986-1987; Student Life Advisory Committee, 1992-1996; Drug Policy Committee, 1990; and several other committees. Reports make up the largest portion of this collection and include reports from the Connelly Center, 1978-1998; the Dean of Students; international students, 1975-1993; student activities; a residence life survey; New Student Orientation Program; music activities; University Senate; and reports from several other University departments and committees. Printed materials in the collection include handbooks, placement manuals, orientation brochures, and activities calendars.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
